ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Collapsing external ear canals
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Explains the artifactual conductive loss with supra-aural headphones and the functional difficulty in noise due to loss of natural canal resonance.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Presbycusis
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient has mild high-frequency sensorineural hearing loss, but this does not account for the initial air-bone gaps or the degree of difficulty in noise.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Middle ear pathology
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Initially suggested by air-bone gaps but ruled out by normal tympanometry, acoustic reflexes, and OAEs.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
Evaluate middle ear function to investigate the conductive component.
Assess integrity of the reflex arc and cross-check middle ear status.
Assess cochlear outer hair cell function; presence contradicts conductive loss.
Retest with insert earphones to rule out collapsing ear canals.

ordered_list.action: Real Ear Probe Tube Microphone Measurement
ordered_list.rationale_short: Measure ear canal resonance in collapsed vs. stented states.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Initial testing with supra-aural headphones revealed a significant conductive/mixed hearing loss, which was inconsistent with normal tympanometry, present ipsilateral reflexes, and normal OAEs. An immediate retest using insert earphones resolved the air-bone gaps, confirming that the initial results were an artifact caused by collapsing ear canals under the pressure of the headphones.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Using TDH-39 earphones: Mild to moderate-severe high-frequency conductive/mixed loss with 35 dB air-bone gaps in high frequencies and 15-20 dB gaps at 250-500 Hz.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRTs consistent with PTA; Word Recognition Scores excellent (96% Right, 92% Left).

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Normal ear canal volume, static compliance, and pressure (Type A) bilaterally.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Contralateral reflexes absent 500-4000 Hz; Ipsilateral reflexes present bilaterally.

tests.name: Otoacoustic Emissions (OAEs)
tests.result_summary: Responses within normal range to 2000 Hz; present but slightly reduced at 4000 Hz.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Using ER-3A insert earphones: Air-bone gaps resolved; thresholds within 5 dB of bone conduction; hearing essentially normal for age.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient returned with continued complaints of difficulty in noise despite 'normal' thresholds. Repeat audiometry confirmed normal sensitivity with inserts. Real-ear measurements demonstrated that the patient's polychondritis causes the ear canals to collapse even without headphones, destroying the natural quarter-wavelength resonance and reducing high-frequency amplification, which explains the functional deficit.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Normal hearing except for mild high-frequency sensorineural loss at 4000 Hz and above.

tests.name: Real Ear Probe Tube Microphone Measurement
tests.result_summary: REUR in collapsed state showed loss of natural resonance; REUR with Lucite stent showed restored resonance similar to a normal unoccluded canal.

proposed_items: Custom-made Lucite stents (hollow ear pieces) to prop open ear canals
Earmold impressions taken with jaw open to minimize canal collapse
counseling_actions: Explain that the initial hearing loss was an artifact of headphones collapsing the ear canals
Clarify that the difficulty in noise is caused by the loss of natural ear canal resonance due to cartilage softening from polychondritis
Explain how the Lucite stents will restore the natural sound pathway and improve hearing in noise

escalation.rationale_short: Referral for management of the underlying polychondritis.

follow_up_plan.objective: Verify benefit of stents and improvement in speech intelligibility index.

expected_outcome: Patient reported ability to carry on normal activities and hear most people, even in many adverse listening environments.
Measured Speech Intelligibility Index (SII) improved from 40% (collapsed state) to 100% (with Lucite stent).
